content.text:
[cron:8b380d56-7314-4ba9-b4c4-ea11d3e5ca6f PR Review Patrol (High Frequency)] High-frequency PR patrol for bills-bot.

Repo: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

Do this each run:
1) List open PRs in BillChirico/bills-bot.
2) Skip bot-authored PRs by default (e.g., coderabbitai, dependabot[bot], renovate[bot]) unless Bill explicitly instructs otherwise.
3) For remaining PRs, count unresolved review threads.
4) If no unresolved threads on eligible PRs: respond exactly `NO_REPLY`.
5) If unresolved threads exist:
   - Spawn ONE sub-agent PER PR (parallel), never batch PRs together.
   - Use agentId `build`, model `anthropic/claude-opus-4-6`, thinking `high`.
   - Include full unresolved thread details (thread id, file path, line, issue summary).
   - Instruct spawned agents to read and follow CODING.md, fix all review comments (including nitpicks unless nonsensical/breaking/redundant), run tests/coverage, resolve threads.
   - Instruct spawned agents NOT to post PR summary comments unless Bill explicitly asks.
   - Have spawned agents report completion summary back to parent agent.
   - After spawning, send Bill a concise Discord DM status update:
     - channel: discord
     - target: user:191633014441115648
     - accountId: pip-build
     - include PR numbers and unresolved thread counts.
6) If any spawned run fails/stalls, note it in DM and respawn once.

Keep updates concise and action-oriented.
Current time: Wednesday, February 11th, 2026 ‚Äî 10:47 PM (America/New_York)

---
name: github
description: "Interact with GitHub using the `gh` CLI. Use `gh issue`, `gh pr`, `gh run`, and `gh api` for issues, PRs, CI runs, and advanced queries."
metadata:
  {
    "openclaw":
      {
        "emoji": "üêô",
        "requires": { "bins": ["gh"] },
        "install":
          [
            {
              "id": "brew",
              "kind": "brew",
              "formula": "gh",
              "bins": ["gh"],
              "label": "Install GitHub CLI (brew)",
            },
            {
              "id": "apt",
              "kind": "apt",
              "package": "gh",
              "bins": ["gh"],
              "label": "Install GitHub CLI (apt)",
            },
          ],
      },
  }
---

# GitHub Skill

Use the `gh` CLI to interact with GitHub. Always specify `--repo owner/repo` when not in a git directory, or use URLs directly.

## Pull Requests

Check CI status on a PR:

```bash
gh pr checks 55 --repo owner/repo
```

List recent workflow runs:

```bash
gh run list --repo owner/repo --limit 10
```

View a run and see which steps failed:

```bash
gh run view <run-id> --repo owner/repo
```

View logs for failed steps only:

```bash
gh run view <run-id> --repo owner/repo --log-failed
```

## API for Advanced Queries

The `gh api` command is useful for accessing data not available through other subcommands.

Get PR with specific fields:

```bash
gh api repos/owner/repo/pulls/55 --jq '.title, .state, .user.login'
```

## JSON Output

Most commands support `--json` for structured output. You can use `--jq` to filter:

```bash
gh issue list --repo owner/repo --json number,title --jq '.[] | "\(.number): \(.title)"'
```

content.name: exec

arguments.command:
set -euo pipefail
repo="BillChirico/bills-bot"
prs_json=$(gh pr list --repo "$repo" --state open --json number,title,headRefName,author,url)
# Build result JSON with unresolved thread details for non-bot PRs
jq -n --argjson prs "$prs_json" '
  def is_bot($login):
    ($login|test("\\[bot\\]$")) or ($login=="coderabbitai") or ($login=="renovate") or ($login=="dependabot") or ($login=="dependabot[bot]");
  {
    open_prs: ($prs|length),
    prs: ($prs | map({number,title,headRefName,url,author:(.author.login),isBot:is_bot(.author.login)}))
  }
' > /tmp/pr_patrol_base.json

# For each eligible PR, fetch unresolved threads with details
eligible_numbers=$(jq -r '.prs[] | select(.isBot|not) | .number' /tmp/pr_patrol_base.json)

# start aggregate file
printf '{"eligible":[],"with_unresolved":[]}' > /tmp/pr_patrol_details.json

for pr in $eligible_numbers; do
  data=$(gh api graphql -f query="query{repository(owner:\"BillChirico\",name:\"bills-bot\"){pullRequest(number:$pr){number title headRefName url author{login} reviewThreads(first:100){nodes{id isResolved path line startLine comments(first:1){nodes{body author{login}}}}}}}}")
  # extract unresolved
  unresolved=$(echo "$data" | jq '{number:.data.repository.pullRequest.number,title:.data.repository.pullRequest.title,headRefName:.data.repository.pullRequest.headRefName,url:.data.repository.pullRequest.url,author:.data.repository.pullRequest.author.login,threads:[.data.repository.pullRequest.reviewThreads.nodes[] | select(.isResolved==false) | {id,path,line:(.line // .startLine),summary:(.comments.nodes[0].body // "")}] } | .threadCount=(.threads|length)')

  tmp=$(mktemp)
  jq --argjson item "$unresolved" '.eligible += [$item] | if ($item.threadCount>0) then .with_unresolved += [$item] else . end' /tmp/pr_patrol_details.json > "$tmp"
  mv "$tmp" /tmp/pr_patrol_details.json
done

jq -n --slurpfile base /tmp/pr_patrol_base.json --slurpfile det /tmp/pr_patrol_details.json '{base:$base[0],details:$det[0]}'

  # extract unresolved

content.name: exec

arguments.command:
python3 - <<'PY'
import json, subprocess, re, sys
repo='BillChirico/bills-bot'

pr_list_cmd=['gh','pr','list','--repo',repo,'--state','open','--json','number,title,headRefName,author,url']
prs=json.loads(subprocess.check_output(pr_list_cmd,text=True) or '[]')

def is_bot(login:str)->bool:
    if not login:
        return False
    return login.endswith('[bot]') or login in {'coderabbitai','renovate','dependabot','dependabot[bot]'}

base={'open_prs':len(prs),'prs':[]}
eligible=[]
with_unresolved=[]
for pr in prs:
    login=(pr.get('author') or {}).get('login','')
    item={
        'number':pr['number'],
        'title':pr['title'],
        'headRefName':pr['headRefName'],
        'url':pr['url'],
        'author':login,
        'isBot':is_bot(login),
    }
    base['prs'].append(item)
    if item['isBot']:
        continue

    q=f'''query{{repository(owner:"BillChirico",name:"bills-bot"){{pullRequest(number:{pr['number']}){{number title headRefName url author{{login}} reviewThreads(first:100){{nodes{{id isResolved path line startLine comments(first:1){{nodes{{body author{{login}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}'''
    out=subprocess.check_output(['gh','api','graphql','-f',f'query={q}'],text=True)
    d=json.loads(out)
    prd=d['data']['repository']['pullRequest']
    threads=[]
    for t in prd['reviewThreads']['nodes']:
        if t.get('isResolved'):
            continue
        body=''
        comments=((t.get('comments') or {}).get('nodes') or [])
        if comments:
            body=comments[0].get('body') or ''
        # normalize summary to first non-empty line, trimmed to 220 chars
        lines=[ln.strip() for ln in body.splitlines() if ln.strip()]
        summary=lines[0] if lines else ''
        if len(summary)>220:
            summary=summary[:217]+'...'
        threads.append({
            'id':t.get('id'),
            'path':t.get('path'),
            'line':t.get('line') if t.get('line') is not None else t.get('startLine'),
            'summary':summary,
        })

    rec={
        'number':prd['number'],
        'title':prd['title'],
        'headRefName':prd['headRefName'],
        'url':prd['url'],
        'author':(prd.get('author') or {}).get('login',''),
        'threads':threads,
        'threadCount':len(threads),
    }
    eligible.append(rec)
    if rec['threadCount']>0:
        with_unresolved.append(rec)

print(json.dumps({'base':base,'details':{'eligible':eligible,'with_unresolved':with_unresolved}},indent=2))
PY

arguments.command:
python3 - <<'PY'
import json, subprocess
pr=19
q=f'''query{{repository(owner:"BillChirico",name:"bills-bot"){{pullRequest(number:{pr}){{reviewThreads(first:100){{nodes{{id isResolved path line startLine comments(first:10){{nodes{{author{{login}} body path outdated}}}}}}}}}}}}}}'''
out=subprocess.check_output(['gh','api','graphql','-f',f'query={q}'],text=True)
d=json.loads(out)
threads=d['data']['repository']['pullRequest']['reviewThreads']['nodes']
for t in threads:
    if t['isResolved']:
        continue
    print('THREAD',t['id'])
    print('PATH',t['path'],'LINE',t['line'] if t['line'] is not None else t['startLine'])
    for c in t['comments']['nodes']:
        print('AUTHOR', (c.get('author') or {}).get('login'))
        print(c['body'])
        print('---')
    print('====')
PY

content.text:
THREAD PRRT_kwDORICdSM5uImCZ
PATH tests/modules/welcome.test.js LINE 174
AUTHOR coderabbitai
_üßπ Nitpick_ | _üîµ Trivial_

**Acceptable smoke test, but consider asserting the actual pruning effect.**

The test exercises the eviction code path without crashing, which is valuable. However, since `activityCallCount` is module-level state shared across tests, the eviction might trigger at a different iteration than expected depending on test execution order.

Consider adding a targeted assertion ‚Äî e.g., recording activity for the stale channel after pruning and checking it doesn't carry old timestamps (by observing side effects through `getCommunitySnapshot` or similar). That said, if no public API exposes the internal Map, this is fine as-is.

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In `@tests/modules/welcome.test.js` around lines 139 - 174, The test currently
only ensures no crash when eviction runs but doesn't assert pruning occurred;
update the test around recordCommunityActivity and the stale channel to verify
pruning by using or adding a public inspector (e.g., getCommunitySnapshot or
similar) to read the stored timestamps for guild 'prune-guild' and channels
'prune-ch' and 'fresh-ch' after the simulated time jump and repeated calls;
specifically, after the vi.restoreAllMocks() call invoke getCommunitySnapshot()
(or add/export such a helper from the welcome module) and assert that 'prune-ch'
has only fresh timestamps (i.e., no timestamps older than the
activityWindowMinutes) or that a subsequent call to recordCommunityActivity for
'prune-ch' creates a new entry rather than reusing old timestamps, ensuring
deterministic behavior regardless of module-level activityCallCount.
```

</details>

<!-- fingerprinting:phantom:poseidon:phoenix -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment by CodeRabbit -->
---
====

- Final check: ensure branch is conflict-free with target branch before finishing.

Findings:
Completed ‚úÖ ‚Äî addressed the unresolved PR #19 review nitpick on `fix/code-review-fixes`.

### What I changed
- Added deterministic pruning assertions to `tests/modules/welcome.test.js` for:
  - initial stale timestamp presence
  - stale channel eviction after eviction interval
  - fresh channel timestamp retention/count
- Added minimal test-only helpers in `src/modules/welcome.js`:

  - `__resetCommunityActivityState()`
- Kept the fix focused to this single review comment.
